qas.question: What do airports use to assure smooth traffic flow between departing and arriving aircraft?
What is an important concern in the operation of an airport?

plausible_answers.text: non-towered, with no air traffic control presence

qas.question: What describes most automated weather stations at an airport?

plausible_answers.text: a traffic pattern to assure smooth traffic flow between departing and arriving aircraft
lighting that help guide planes using the runways and taxiways at night or in rain, snow, or fog

qas.question: What is available to help air traffic control with flights?

plausible_answers.text: some form of automated airport weather station, a human observer or a combination of the two

qas.question: What does an air traffic control system also use?
What is an important concern for pilots?

context: The majority of the world's airports are <b2_0>non-towered, with no air traffic control presence<b2_0/>. Busy airports have air traffic control (ATC) system. All airports use <b3_0>a <a0_0>traffic pattern<a0_0/> to assure smooth traffic flow between departing and arriving aircraft<b3_0/>. There are a number of aids available to pilots, though not all airports are equipped with them. Many airports have <b4_0>lighting that help guide planes using the runways and taxiways at night or in rain, snow, or fog<b4_0/>. In the U.S. and Canada, the vast majority of airports, large and small, will either have <b5_0>some form of automated airport weather station, a human observer or a combination of the two<b5_0/>. <a1_0><b6_0>Air safety<b6_0/><a1_0/> is an important concern in the operation of an airport, and airports often have their own safety services.
